content.description: Beautiful, blunt, orange arete with a couple of hard moves around the first and second bolts.
content.protection: 4 bolts with bolted anchors at the top.
content.location: Obvious short, blunt, orange arete before Carolina Crocker and the Tipple of Doom.

climbs.name: Raiders of the Lost Crag
climbs.fa: Rick Fairtrace, Rick Fairtrace Jr., Scott Jones 1987

content.description: Meat and potatoes,scruffy crack climbing is what this route is all about. Head up an easy hand crack to the first roof (crux) where you engineer a way to jam or crimp your way out and over of it. Keep jamming away for a few moves, trend right, and establish yourself in the alcove where you'll need to again find a way to surmount the roof. Twenty more feet of scruffy climbing guard the cordalette slung tree that is your anchor.
content.protection: Lots of hand sizes. BD #4 will be useful at the crux. A cordalette slung around two bomber trees with two biners made up the anchor as of 5/31/12. All were in good shape.
content.location: Just right of Caroline Crocker and the Tipple of Doom.

climbs.name: Mountaineer Matt and the Thundering Boom

content.description: Climb the wide crack to a ledge rest, then fire up the series of corners and roof cracks. A wild ride! Bring a 70m
content.protection: Standard rack, use a tree for anchor
content.location: Start in the wide crack right of SLAP

content.description: Since the buttress is called Fire and Ice, you might expect more from this climb.  Climb the thin hands crack(crux) for about 25 Ft to a ledge.  Continue up some really dirty corners to rap from a tree.  The bottom is really nice, but dirty, and the crux is even shorter.  This is worth doing along with Fire if you are in the area.  If you are looking to bag a fairly easy 11c, this might be a good candidate
content.protection: Thin hands gear, .75 camalot or so.  Tree with slings at top.
content.location: Just behind a large tree, to the left of 2 obvious short cracks.

content.description: This climb makes a nice warm up for Ice.  Climb the crack and traverse right about 5 Ft. to reach the anchors.  This crack has some interesting moves.
content.protection: A fairly wide range of gear can be used.  Bolted anchor.
content.location: The right of two short cracks.  Just to the right of Ice.

climbs.name: Carolina Crocker and the Tipple of  Doom

content.description: Holy adventure sport climbing!!! Figure out the low crux and then get your sport orienteering skills on. Varied climbing with slabby traversing, big cranks, and crimp and pimping guard the anchors. FUN SHtuff!
content.protection: Ca. 10 bolts plus two for the anchors. Bolted anchor. Be careful falling at the crux (3rd bolt), a lot of slack could cause a ground fall.
content.location: In the depths of the Kaymoor Jungle. Just past Albatross, the ridiculously thin bolted seam, and right next to the scruffy crack climb, Raiders of the Lost Crag.
